command.name: listResourceIcon
command.description: Lists the resource icon for the specified resource(s)

arg.name: resourceids
arg.description: list of resources to upload the icon/image for

arg.name: resourcetype
arg.description: type of the resource

arg.name: base64image
arg.description: base64 representation of resource icon

arg.name: resourceid
arg.description: id of the resource

arg.name: resourcetype
arg.description: resource type

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: the display text of the vpc offering

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the vpc offering

arg.name: supportedservices
arg.description: services supported by the vpc offering

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the containing domain(s), null for public offerings

arg.name: enable
arg.description: set to true if the offering is to be enabled during creation. Default is false

arg.name: internetprotocol
arg.description: The internet protocol of the offering. Options are ipv4 and dualstack. Default is ipv4. dualstack will create an offering that supports both IPv4 and IPv6

arg.name: servicecapabilitylist
arg.description: desired service capabilities as part of vpc offering

arg.name: serviceofferingid
arg.description: the ID of the service offering for the VPC router appliance

arg.name: serviceproviderlist
arg.description: provider to service mapping. If not specified, the provider for the service will be mapped to the default provider on the physical network

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the ID of the containing zone(s), null for public offerings

arg.name: id
arg.description: the id of the vpc offering

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date this vpc offering was created

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: an alternate display text of the vpc offering.

arg.name: distributedvpcrouter
arg.description: indicates if the vpc offering supports distributed router for one-hop forwarding

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain name(s) this disk offering belongs to. Ignore this information as it is not currently applicable.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain ID(s) this disk offering belongs to. Ignore this information as it is not currently applicable.

arg.name: internetprotocol
arg.description: the internet protocol of the vpc offering

arg.name: isdefault
arg.description: true if vpc offering is default, false otherwise

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the vpc offering

arg.name: state
arg.description: state of the vpc offering. Can be Disabled/Enabled

arg.name: supportsregionLevelvpc
arg.description: indicated if the offering can support region level vpc

arg.name: zone
arg.description: the zone name(s) this disk offering belongs to. Ignore this information as it is not currently applicable.

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the zone ID(s) this disk offering belongs to. Ignore this information as it is not currently applicable.

arg.name: service(*)
arg.description: the list of supported services

arg.name: name
arg.description: the service name

arg.name: capability(*)
arg.description: the list of capabilities

arg.name: canchooseservicecapability
arg.description: can this service capability value can be choosable while creatine network offerings

arg.name: name
arg.description: the capability name

arg.name: value
arg.description: the capability value

arg.name: provider(*)
arg.description: the service provider name

arg.name: id
arg.description: uuid of the network provider

arg.name: canenableindividualservice
arg.description: true if individual services can be enabled/disabled

arg.name: destinationphysicalnetworkid
arg.description: the destination physical network

arg.name: name
arg.description: the provider name

arg.name: physicalnetworkid
arg.description: the physical network this belongs to

arg.name: servicelist
arg.description: services for this provider

arg.name: state
arg.description: state of the network provider

command.name: ldapCreateAccount
command.description: Creates an account from an LDAP user

arg.name: username
arg.description: Unique username.

arg.name: account
arg.description: Creates the user under the specified account. If no account is specified, the username will be used as the account name.

arg.name: accountdetails
arg.description: details for account used to store specific parameters

arg.name: accountid
arg.description: Account UUID, required for adding account from external provisioning system

arg.name: accounttype
arg.description: Type of the account. Specify 0 for user, 1 for root admin, and 2 for domain admin

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: Creates the user under the specified domain.

arg.name: networkdomain
arg.description: Network domain for the account's networks

arg.name: roleid
arg.description: Creates the account under the specified role.

arg.name: timezone
arg.description: Specifies a timezone for this command. For more information on the timezone parameter, see Time Zone Format.

arg.name: userid
arg.description: User UUID, required for adding account from external provisioning system

arg.name: id
arg.description: the id of the account

arg.name: accountdetails
arg.description: details for the account

arg.name: accounttype
arg.description: account type (admin, domain-admin, user)

arg.name: cpuavailable
arg.description: the total number of cpu cores available to be created for this account

arg.name: cpulimit
arg.description: the total number of cpu cores the account can own

arg.name: cputotal
arg.description: the total number of cpu cores owned by account

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date when this account was created

arg.name: defaultzoneid
arg.description: the default zone of the account

arg.name: domain
arg.description: name of the Domain the account belongs to

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: id of the Domain the account belongs to

arg.name: domainpath
arg.description: path of the Domain the account belongs to

arg.name: groups
arg.description: the list of acl groups that account belongs to

arg.name: icon
arg.description: Base64 string representation of the resource icon

arg.name: ipavailable
arg.description: the total number of public ip addresses available for this account to acquire

arg.name: iplimit
arg.description: the total number of public ip addresses this account can acquire

arg.name: iptotal
arg.description: the total number of public ip addresses allocated for this account

arg.name: iscleanuprequired
arg.description: true if the account requires cleanup

arg.name: isdefault
arg.description: true if account is default, false otherwise

arg.name: memoryavailable
arg.description: the total memory (in MB) available to be created for this account

arg.name: memorylimit
arg.description: the total memory (in MB) the account can own

arg.name: memorytotal
arg.description: the total memory (in MB) owned by account

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the account

arg.name: networkavailable
arg.description: the total number of networks available to be created for this account

arg.name: networkdomain
arg.description: the network domain

arg.name: networklimit
arg.description: the total number of networks the account can own

arg.name: networktotal
arg.description: the total number of networks owned by account

arg.name: primarystorageavailable
arg.description: the total primary storage space (in GiB) available to be used for this account

arg.name: primarystoragelimit
arg.description: the total primary storage space (in GiB) the account can own

arg.name: primarystoragetotal
arg.description: the total primary storage space (in GiB) owned by account

arg.name: projectavailable
arg.description: the total number of projects available for administration by this account

arg.name: projectlimit
arg.description: the total number of projects the account can own

arg.name: projecttotal
arg.description: the total number of projects being administrated by this account

arg.name: receivedbytes
arg.description: the total number of network traffic bytes received

arg.name: roleid
arg.description: the ID of the role

arg.name: rolename
arg.description: the name of the role

arg.name: roletype
arg.description: the type of the role (Admin, ResourceAdmin, DomainAdmin, User)

arg.name: secondarystorageavailable
arg.description: the total secondary storage space (in GiB) available to be used for this account

arg.name: secondarystoragelimit
arg.description: the total secondary storage space (in GiB) the account can own

arg.name: secondarystoragetotal
arg.description: the total secondary storage space (in GiB) owned by account

arg.name: sentbytes
arg.description: the total number of network traffic bytes sent

arg.name: snapshotavailable
arg.description: the total number of snapshots available for this account

arg.name: snapshotlimit
arg.description: the total number of snapshots which can be stored by this account

arg.name: snapshottotal
arg.description: the total number of snapshots stored by this account

arg.name: state
arg.description: the state of the account

arg.name: templateavailable
arg.description: the total number of templates available to be created by this account

arg.name: templatelimit
arg.description: the total number of templates which can be created by this account

arg.name: templatetotal
arg.description: the total number of templates which have been created by this account

arg.name: vmavailable
arg.description: the total number of virtual machines available for this account to acquire

arg.name: vmlimit
arg.description: the total number of virtual machines that can be deployed by this account

arg.name: vmrunning
arg.description: the total number of virtual machines running for this account

arg.name: vmstopped
arg.description: the total number of virtual machines stopped for this account

arg.name: vmtotal
arg.description: the total number of virtual machines deployed by this account

arg.name: volumeavailable
arg.description: the total volume available for this account

arg.name: volumelimit
arg.description: the total volume which can be used by this account

arg.name: volumetotal
arg.description: the total volume being used by this account

arg.name: vpcavailable
arg.description: the total number of vpcs available to be created for this account

arg.name: vpclimit
arg.description: the total number of vpcs the account can own

arg.name: vpctotal
arg.description: the total number of vpcs owned by account

arg.name: timezone

arg.name: usersource

command.name: removeRawUsageRecords
command.description: Safely removes raw records from cloud_usage table

arg.name: interval
arg.description: Specify the number of days (greater than zero) to remove records that are older than those number of days from today. For example, specifying 10 would result in removing all the records created before 10 days from today

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success
arg.description: true if operation is executed successfully

command.name: copyIso
command.description: Copies an iso from one zone to another.

arg.name: id
arg.description: Template ID.

arg.name: destzoneid
arg.description: ID of the zone the template is being copied to.

arg.name: destzoneids
arg.description: A list of IDs of the zones that the template needs to be copied to.Specify this list if the template needs to copied to multiple zones in one go. Do not specify destzoneid and destzoneids together, however one of them is required.

arg.name: sourcezoneid
arg.description: ID of the zone the template is currently hosted on. If not specified and template is cross-zone, then we will sync this template to region wide image store.

arg.name: id
arg.description: the template ID

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account name to which the template belongs

arg.name: accountid
arg.description: the account id to which the template belongs

arg.name: bits
arg.description: the processor bit size

arg.name: bootable
arg.description: true if the ISO is bootable, false otherwise

arg.name: checksum
arg.description: checksum of the template

arg.name: childtemplates
arg.description: if root disk template, then ids of the datas disk templates this template owns

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date this template was created

arg.name: crossZones
arg.description: true if the template is managed across all Zones, false otherwise

arg.name: deployasis
arg.description: VMware only: true if template is deployed without orchestrating disks and networks but "as-is" defined in the template.

arg.name: deployasisdetails
arg.description: VMware only: additional key/value details tied with deploy-as-is template

arg.name: details
arg.description: additional key/value details tied with template

arg.name: directdownload
arg.description: KVM Only: true if template is directly downloaded to Primary Storage bypassing Secondary Storage

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: the template display text

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the name of the domain to which the template belongs

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain to which the template belongs

arg.name: downloaddetails
arg.description: Lists the download progress of a template across all secondary storages

arg.name: format
arg.description: the format of the template.

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the ID of the secondary storage host for the template

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: the name of the secondary storage host for the template

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which the template runs

arg.name: icon
arg.description: Base64 string representation of the resource icon

arg.name: isdynamicallyscalable
arg.description: true if template contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory

arg.name: isextractable
arg.description: true if the template is extractable, false otherwise

arg.name: isfeatured
arg.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

arg.name: ispublic
arg.description: true if this template is a public template, false otherwise

arg.name: isready
arg.description: true if the template is ready to be deployed from, false otherwise.

arg.name: name
arg.description: the template name

arg.name: ostypeid
arg.description: the ID of the OS type for this template.

arg.name: ostypename
arg.description: the name of the OS type for this template.

arg.name: parenttemplateid
arg.description: if Datadisk template, then id of the root disk template this template belongs to

arg.name: passwordenabled
arg.description: true if the reset password feature is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: physicalsize
arg.description: the physical size of the template

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the template

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id of the template

arg.name: removed
arg.description: the date this template was removed

arg.name: requireshvm
arg.description: true if template requires HVM enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: size
arg.description: the size of the template

arg.name: sourcetemplateid
arg.description: the template ID of the parent template if present

arg.name: sshkeyenabled
arg.description: true if template is sshkey enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: status
arg.description: the status of the template

arg.name: templatetag
arg.description: the tag of this template

arg.name: templatetype
arg.description: the type of the template

arg.name: url
arg.description: the URL which the template/iso is registered from

arg.name: userdataid
arg.description: the id of userdata linked to this template

arg.name: userdataname
arg.description: the name of userdata linked to this template

arg.name: userdataparams
arg.description: list of parameters which contains the list of keys or string parameters that are needed to be passed for any variables declared in userdata

arg.name: userdatapolicy
arg.description: the userdata override policy with the userdata provided while deploying VM

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the ID of the zone for this template

arg.name: zonename
arg.description: the name of the zone for this template

arg.name: jobid
arg.description: the ID of the latest async job acting on this object

arg.name: jobstatus
arg.description: the current status of the latest async job acting on this object

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the autoscale profile

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success
arg.description: true if operation is executed successfully

command.name: provisionCertificate
command.description: Issues and propagates client certificate on a connected host/agent using configured CA plugin

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: The host/agent uuid to which the certificate has to be provisioned (issued and propagated)

arg.name: provider
arg.description: Name of the CA service provider, otherwise the default configured provider plugin will be used

arg.name: reconnect
arg.description: Whether to attempt reconnection with host/agent after successful deployment of certificate. When option is not provided, configured global setting is used

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success
arg.description: true if operation is executed successfully

arg.name: account
arg.description: list resources by account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

arg.name: accumulate
arg.description: Accumulates the VM metrics data instead of returning only the most recent data collected. The default behavior is set by the global configuration vm.stats.increment.metrics.

arg.name: affinitygroupid
arg.description: list vms by affinity group

arg.name: autoscalevmgroupid
arg.description: the ID of AutoScaling VM Group

arg.name: backupofferingid
arg.description: list by the backup offering

arg.name: clusterid
arg.description: the cluster ID

arg.name: details
arg.description: comma separated list of host details requested, value can be a list of [all, group, nics, stats, secgrp, tmpl, servoff, diskoff, iso, volume, min, affgrp]. If no parameter is passed in, the details will be defaulted to all

arg.name: displayvm
arg.description: list resources by display flag; only ROOT admin is eligible to pass this parameter

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: list only resources belonging to the domain specified

arg.name: forvirtualnetwork
arg.description: list by network type; true if need to list vms using Virtual Network, false otherwise

arg.name: groupid
arg.description: the group ID

arg.name: haenable
arg.description: list by the High Availability offering; true if filtering VMs with HA enabled; false for VMs with HA disabled

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the host ID

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the target hypervisor for the template

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: ids
arg.description: the IDs of the virtual machines, mutually exclusive with id

arg.name: isoid
arg.description: list vms by iso

arg.name: isrecursive
arg.description: defaults to false, but if true, lists all resources from the parent specified by the domainId till leaves.

arg.name: keypair
arg.description: list vms by ssh keypair name

arg.name: keyword
arg.description: List by keyword

arg.name: listall
arg.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false. Resources dedicated to a project are listed only if using the projectid parameter.

arg.name: name
arg.description: name of the virtual machine (a substring match is made against the parameter value, data for all matching VMs will be returned)

arg.name: networkid
arg.description: list by network id

arg.name: podid
arg.description: the pod ID

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: list objects by project; if projectid=-1 lists All VMs

arg.name: securitygroupid
arg.description: the security group ID

arg.name: serviceofferingid
arg.description: list by the service offering

arg.name: showicon
arg.description: flag to display the resource icon for VMs

arg.name: state
arg.description: state of the virtual machine. Possible values are: Running, Stopped, Present, Destroyed, Expunged. Present is used for the state equal not destroyed.

arg.name: storageid
arg.description: the storage ID where vm's volumes belong to

arg.name: tags
arg.description: List resources by tags (key/value pairs)

arg.name: templateid
arg.description: list vms by template

arg.name: userdata
arg.description: Whether to return the VMs' user data or not. By default, user data will not be returned.

arg.name: userid
arg.description: the user ID that created the VM and is under the account that owns the VM

arg.name: vpcid
arg.description: list vms by vpc

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the availability zone ID

arg.name: cputotal
arg.description: the total cpu capacity in Ghz

arg.name: diskiopstotal
arg.description: the total disk iops

arg.name: diskread
arg.description: disk read in MiB

arg.name: diskwrite
arg.description: disk write in MiB

arg.name: ipaddress
arg.description: the VM's primary IP address

arg.name: memorytotal
arg.description: the total memory capacity in GiB

arg.name: networkread
arg.description: network read in MiB

arg.name: networkwrite
arg.description: network write in MiB

arg.name: clusterid
arg.description: lists hosts existing in particular cluster

arg.name: details
arg.description: comma separated list of host details requested, value can be a list of [ min, all, capacity, events, stats]

arg.name: hahost
arg.description: if true, list only hosts dedicated to HA

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: hypervisor type of host: XenServer,KVM,VMware,Hyperv,BareMetal,Simulator

arg.name: id
arg.description: the id of the host

arg.name: keyword
arg.description: List by keyword

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the host

arg.name: outofbandmanagementenabled
arg.description: list hosts for which out-of-band management is enabled

arg.name: outofbandmanagementpowerstate
arg.description: list hosts by its out-of-band management interface's power state. Its value can be one of [On, Off, Unknown]

arg.name: podid
arg.description: the Pod ID for the host

arg.name: resourcestate
arg.description: list hosts by resource state. Resource state represents current state determined by admin of host, value can be one of [Enabled, Disabled, Unmanaged, PrepareForMaintenance, ErrorInMaintenance, Maintenance, Error]

arg.name: state
arg.description: the state of the host

arg.name: type
arg.description: the host type

arg.name: virtualmachineid
arg.description: lists hosts in the same cluster as this VM and flag hosts with enough CPU/RAm to host this VM

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the Zone ID for the host

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the host

arg.name: annotation
arg.description: the last annotation set on this host by an admin

arg.name: capabilities
arg.description: capabilities of the host

arg.name: clusterid
arg.description: the cluster ID of the host

arg.name: clustername
arg.description: the cluster name of the host

arg.name: clustertype
arg.description: the cluster type of the cluster that host belongs to

arg.name: cpuallocated
arg.description: the amount of the host's CPU currently allocated

arg.name: cpuallocatedpercentage
arg.description: the amount of the host's CPU currently allocated in percentage

arg.name: cpuallocatedvalue
arg.description: the amount of the host's CPU currently allocated in MHz

arg.name: cpuallocatedwithoverprovisioning
arg.description: the amount of the host's CPU currently allocated after applying the cpu.overprovisioning.factor

arg.name: cpuloadaverage
arg.description: the cpu average load on the host

arg.name: cpunumber
arg.description: the CPU number of the host

arg.name: cpusockets
arg.description: the number of CPU sockets on the host

arg.name: cpuspeed
arg.description: the CPU speed of the host

arg.name: cpuused
arg.description: the amount of the host's CPU currently used

arg.name: cpuwithoverprovisioning
arg.description: the amount of the host's CPU after applying the cpu.overprovisioning.factor

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date and time the host was created

arg.name: details
arg.description: Host details in key/value pairs.

arg.name: disconnected
arg.description: true if the host is disconnected. False otherwise.

arg.name: disksizeallocated
arg.description: the host's currently allocated disk size

arg.name: disksizetotal
arg.description: the total disk size of the host

arg.name: encryptionsupported
arg.description: true if the host supports encryption

arg.name: events
arg.description: events available for the host

arg.name: hahost
arg.description: true if the host is Ha host (dedicated to vms started by HA process; false otherwise

arg.name: hasenoughcapacity
arg.description: true if this host has enough CPU and RAM capacity to migrate a VM to it, false otherwise

arg.name: hostha
arg.description: the host HA information information

arg.name: hosttags
arg.description: comma-separated list of tags for the host

arg.name: hypervisor

Default value is "all".* account : account networks that have been registered for or created by the calling user. * domain : domain networks that have been registered for or created by the calling user. * accountdomain : account and domain networks that have been registered for or created by the calling user. * shared : networks that have been granted to the calling user by another user. * all : all networks (account, domain and shared).

command.name: updateResourceLimit
command.description: Updates resource limits for an account or domain.

arg.name: resourcetype
arg.description: Type of resource to update. Values are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 11. 0 - Instance. Number of instances a user can create. 1 - IP. Number of public IP addresses a user can own. 2 - Volume. Number of disk volumes a user can create. 3 - Snapshot. Number of snapshots a user can create. 4 - Template. Number of templates that a user can register/create. 6 - Network. Number of guest network a user can create. 7 - VPC. Number of VPC a user can create. 8 - CPU. Total number of CPU cores a user can use. 9 - Memory. Total Memory (in MB) a user can use. 10 - PrimaryStorage. Total primary storage space (in GiB) a user can use. 11 - SecondaryStorage. Total secondary storage space (in GiB) a user can use.

arg.name: account
arg.description: Update resource for a specified account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: Update resource limits for all accounts in specified domain. If used with the account parameter, updates resource limits for a specified account in specified domain.

arg.name: max
arg.description: Maximum resource limit.

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: Update resource limits for project

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account of the resource limit

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain name of the resource limit

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain ID of the resource limit

arg.name: max
arg.description: the maximum number of the resource. A -1 means the resource currently has no limit.

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the resource limit

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id of the resource limit

arg.description: resource type. Values include 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11. See the resourceType parameter for more information on these values.

arg.description: resource type name. Values include user_vm, public_ip, volume, snapshot, template, project, network, vpc, cpu, memory, primary_storage, secondary_storage.

command.name: getSolidFireVolumeSize
command.description: Get the SF volume size including Hypervisor Snapshot Reserve

arg.name: volumeid
arg.description: Volume UUID

arg.name: solidFireVolumeSize
arg.description: SolidFire Volume Size Including Hypervisor Snapshot Reserve

arg.name: format
arg.description: the format for the volume. Possible values include QCOW2, OVA, and VHD.

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the volume

arg.name: url
arg.description: the URL of where the volume is hosted. Possible URL include http:// and https://

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the ID of the zone the volume is to be hosted on

arg.name: account
arg.description: an optional accountName. Must be used with domainId.

arg.name: checksum
arg.description: the checksum value of this volume. The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed and just a plain ascii/utf8 representation of a hexadecimal string. If it is required to use another algorithm the hexadecimal string is to be prefixed with a string of the form, "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string representing the java supported algorithm, i.e. MD5 or SHA-256. Note that java does not contain an algorithm called SHA256 or one called sha-256, only SHA-256.

arg.name: diskofferingid
arg.description: the ID of the disk offering. This must be a custom sized offering since during uploadVolume volume size is unknown.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: an optional domainId. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

arg.name: imagestoreuuid
arg.description: Image store uuid

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: Upload volume for the project

arg.name: id
arg.description: ID of the disk volume

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the disk volume

arg.name: attached
arg.description: the date the volume was attached to a VM instance

arg.name: chaininfo
arg.description: the chain info of the volume

arg.name: clusterid
arg.description: cluster id of the volume

arg.name: clustername
arg.description: cluster name where the volume is allocated

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date the disk volume was created

arg.name: destroyed
arg.description: the boolean state of whether the volume is destroyed or not

arg.name: deviceid
arg.description: the ID of the device on user vm the volume is attahed to. This tag is not returned when the volume is detached.

arg.name: diskBytesReadRate
arg.description: bytes read rate of the disk volume

arg.name: diskBytesWriteRate
arg.description: bytes write rate of the disk volume

arg.description: IO requests read rate of the disk volume per the disk offering

arg.name: diskIopsWriteRate
arg.description: IO requests write rate of the disk volume per the disk offering

arg.description: name of the disk volume

arg.name: openfirewall
arg.description: if true, firewall rule for source/end public port is automatically created; if false - firewall rule has to be created explicitly. Has value true by default

arg.description: the id of the remote access vpn

arg.name: fordisplay
arg.description: is vpn for display to the regular user

arg.name: iprange
arg.description: the range of ips to allocate to the clients

arg.description: the ipsec preshared key

arg.description: the project name of the vpn

arg.description: the project id of the vpn

arg.name: publicip
arg.description: the public ip address of the vpn server

arg.name: publicipid
arg.description: the public ip address of the vpn server

arg.name: state
arg.description: the state of the rule

command.name: changeServiceForVirtualMachine
command.description: (This API is deprecated, use scaleVirtualMachine API)Changes the service offering for a virtual machine. The virtual machine must be in a "Stopped" state for this command to take effect.

arg.name: id
arg.description: The ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: serviceofferingid
arg.description: the service offering ID to apply to the virtual machine

arg.name: automigrate
arg.description: Flag for automatic migration of the root volume with new compute offering whenever migration is required to apply the offering

arg.name: details
arg.description: name value pairs of custom parameters for cpuspeed, memory and cpunumber. example details[i].name=value

arg.name: maxiops
arg.description: New maximum number of IOPS for the custom disk offering

arg.name: miniops
arg.description: New minimum number of IOPS for the custom disk offering

arg.name: shrinkok
arg.description: Verify OK to Shrink

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the virtual machine

arg.name: autoscalevmgroupid
arg.description: ID of AutoScale VM group

arg.name: autoscalevmgroupname
arg.description: Name of AutoScale VM group

arg.name: backupofferingid
arg.description: the ID of the backup offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: backupofferingname
arg.description: the name of the backup offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: bootmode
arg.description: Guest vm Boot Mode

arg.name: boottype
arg.description: Guest vm Boot Type

arg.name: cpunumber
arg.description: the number of vCPUs this virtual machine is using

arg.name: cpuspeed
arg.description: the speed of each vCPU

arg.name: cpuused
arg.description: the amount of the vm's CPU currently used

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date when this virtual machine was created

arg.name: details
arg.description: Vm details in key/value pairs.

arg.name: diskioread
arg.description: the read (IO) of disk on the VM

arg.name: diskiowrite
arg.description: the write (IO) of disk on the VM

arg.name: diskkbsread
arg.description: the VM's disk read in KiB

arg.name: diskkbswrite
arg.description: the VM's disk write in KiB

arg.name: diskofferingid
arg.description: the ID of the disk offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: diskofferingname
arg.description: the name of the disk offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: displayname
arg.description: user generated name. The name of the virtual machine is returned if no displayname exists.

arg.name: displayvm
arg.description: an optional field whether to the display the vm to the end user or not.

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the name of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: forvirtualnetwork
arg.description: the virtual network for the service offering

arg.name: group
arg.description: the group name of the virtual machine

arg.name: groupid

arg.name: guestosid

arg.name: haenable

arg.name: hostcontrolstate
arg.description: the control state of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the ID of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: the name of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which the template runs

arg.name: icon
arg.description: Base64 string representation of the resource icon

arg.name: instancename
arg.description: instance name of the user vm; this parameter is returned to the ROOT admin only

arg.name: isdynamicallyscalable
arg.description: true if vm contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory.

arg.name: isodisplaytext

command.name: listTemplates
command.description: List all public, private, and privileged templates.

arg.name: templatefilter
arg.description: possible values are "featured", "self", "selfexecutable","sharedexecutable","executable", and "community". * featured : templates that have been marked as featured and public. * self : templates that have been registered or created by the calling user. * selfexecutable : same as self, but only returns templates that can be used to deploy a new VM. * sharedexecutable : templates ready to be deployed that have been granted to the calling user by another user. * executable : templates that are owned by the calling user, or public templates, that can be used to deploy a VM. * community : templates that have been marked as public but not featured. * all : all templates (only usable by admins).

arg.name: account
arg.description: list resources by account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

arg.name: details
arg.description: comma separated list of template details requested, value can be a list of [ all, min]

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: list only resources belonging to the domain specified

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor for which to restrict the search

arg.name: id
arg.description: the template ID

arg.name: ids
arg.description: the IDs of the templates, mutually exclusive with id

arg.name: isrecursive
arg.description: defaults to false, but if true, lists all resources from the parent specified by the domainId till leaves.

arg.name: keyword
arg.description: List by keyword

arg.name: listall
arg.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false. Resources dedicated to a project are listed only if using the projectid parameter.

arg.name: name
arg.description: the template name

arg.name: parenttemplateid
arg.description: list datadisk templates by parent template id

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: list objects by project; if projectid=-1 lists All VMs

arg.name: showicon
arg.description: flag to display the resource image for the templates

arg.name: showremoved
arg.description: show removed templates as well

arg.name: showunique
arg.description: If set to true, list only unique templates across zones

arg.name: tags
arg.description: List resources by tags (key/value pairs)

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: list templates by zoneId

arg.name: id
arg.description: the template ID

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account name to which the template belongs

arg.name: accountid
arg.description: the account id to which the template belongs

arg.name: bits
arg.description: the processor bit size

arg.name: bootable
arg.description: true if the ISO is bootable, false otherwise

arg.name: checksum
arg.description: checksum of the template

arg.name: childtemplates
arg.description: if root disk template, then ids of the datas disk templates this template owns

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date this template was created

arg.name: crossZones
arg.description: true if the template is managed across all Zones, false otherwise

arg.name: deployasis
arg.description: VMware only: true if template is deployed without orchestrating disks and networks but "as-is" defined in the template.

arg.name: deployasisdetails
arg.description: VMware only: additional key/value details tied with deploy-as-is template

arg.name: details
arg.description: additional key/value details tied with template

arg.name: directdownload
arg.description: KVM Only: true if template is directly downloaded to Primary Storage bypassing Secondary Storage

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: the template display text

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the name of the domain to which the template belongs

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain to which the template belongs

arg.name: downloaddetails
arg.description: Lists the download progress of a template across all secondary storages

arg.name: format
arg.description: the format of the template.

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the ID of the secondary storage host for the template

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: the name of the secondary storage host for the template

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which the template runs

arg.name: icon
arg.description: Base64 string representation of the resource icon

arg.name: isdynamicallyscalable
arg.description: true if template contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory

arg.name: isextractable
arg.description: true if the template is extractable, false otherwise

arg.name: isfeatured
arg.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

arg.name: ispublic
arg.description: true if this template is a public template, false otherwise

arg.name: isready
arg.description: true if the template is ready to be deployed from, false otherwise.

arg.name: name
arg.description: the template name

arg.name: ostypeid
arg.description: the ID of the OS type for this template.

arg.name: ostypename
arg.description: the name of the OS type for this template.

arg.name: parenttemplateid
arg.description: if Datadisk template, then id of the root disk template this template belongs to

arg.name: passwordenabled
arg.description: true if the reset password feature is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: physicalsize
arg.description: the physical size of the template

arg.name: project

command.name: quotaTariffUpdate
command.description: Update the tariff plan for a resource

arg.name: name
arg.description: Quota tariff's name

arg.name: activationrule
arg.description: Quota tariff's activation rule. It can receive a JS script that results in either a boolean or a numeric value: if it results in a boolean value, the tariff value will be applied according to the result; if it results in a numeric value, the numeric value will be applied; if the result is neither a boolean nor a numeric value, the tariff will not be applied. If the rule is not informed, the tariff value will be applied. Inform empty to remove the activation rule.

arg.name: userfilter
arg.description: Determines what type of filter is applied on the list of users returned from LDAP. valid values are 'NoFilter' no filtering is done, 'LocalDomain' users already in the current or requested domain will be filtered out of the result list, 'AnyDomain' users that already exist anywhere in cloudstack will be filtered out, and 'PotentialImport' all users that would be automatically imported from the listing will be shown, including those that are already in cloudstack, the later will be annotated with their userSource

command.name: login
command.description: Logs a user into the CloudStack. A successful login attempt will generate a JSESSIONID cookie value that can be passed in subsequent Query command calls until the "logout" command has been issued or the session has expired.

arg.name: password
arg.description: Hashed password (Default is MD5). If you wish to use any other hashing algorithm, you would need to write a custom authentication adapter See Docs section.

arg.name: username
arg.description: Username

arg.name: domain
arg.description: Path of the domain that the user belongs to. Example: domain=/com/cloud/internal. If no domain is passed in, the ROOT (/) domain is assumed.

arg.name: domainId
arg.description: The id of the domain that the user belongs to. If both domain and domainId are passed in, "domainId" parameter takes precendence

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account name the user belongs to

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: Domain ID that the user belongs to

arg.name: firstname
arg.description: first name of the user

arg.name: is2faenabled
arg.description: Is two factor authentication enabled

arg.name: is2faverified
arg.description: Is two factor authentication verified

arg.name: issuerfor2fa
arg.description: Two factor authentication issuer

arg.name: lastname
arg.description: last name of the user

arg.name: providerfor2fa
arg.description: Two factor authentication provider

arg.name: registered
arg.description: Is user registered

arg.name: sessionkey
arg.description: Session key that can be passed in subsequent Query command calls

arg.name: timeout
arg.description: the time period before the session has expired

arg.name: timezone
arg.description: user time zone

arg.name: timezoneoffset
arg.description: user time zoneoffset

arg.name: type
arg.description: the account type (admin, domain-admin, read-only-admin, user)

arg.name: userid
arg.description: User ID

arg.name: username
arg.description: Username

command.name: restartNetwork
command.description: Restarts the network; includes 1) restarting network elements - virtual routers, DHCP servers 2) reapplying all public IPs 3) reapplying loadBalancing/portForwarding rules

arg.description: The ID of the network to restart.

arg.name: cleanup
arg.description: If cleanup old network elements

arg.name: livepatch
arg.description: Live patches the router software before restarting it. This parameter will only work when 'cleanup' is false.

arg.name: makeredundant
arg.description: Turn the network into a network with redundant routers.

command.name: assignVolume
command.description: Changes ownership of a Volume from one account to another.

arg.name: volumeid
arg.description: The ID of the volume to be reassigned.

arg.name: accountid
arg.description: The ID of the account to which the volume will be assigned. Mutually exclusive with parameter 'projectid'.

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: The ID of the project to which the volume will be assigned. Mutually exclusive with 'accountid'.

arg.name: id
arg.description: ID of the disk volume

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the disk volume

arg.name: attached
arg.description: the date the volume was attached to a VM instance

arg.name: chaininfo
arg.description: the chain info of the volume

arg.name: clusterid
arg.description: cluster id of the volume

arg.name: clustername
arg.description: cluster name where the volume is allocated

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date the disk volume was created

arg.name: destroyed
arg.description: the boolean state of whether the volume is destroyed or not

arg.name: deviceid
arg.description: the ID of the device on user vm the volume is attahed to. This tag is not returned when the volume is detached.

arg.name: diskBytesReadRate
arg.description: bytes read rate of the disk volume

arg.name: diskBytesWriteRate
arg.description: bytes write rate of the disk volume

arg.name: diskIopsReadRate
arg.description: IO requests read rate of the disk volume per the disk offering

arg.name: diskIopsWriteRate
arg.description: IO requests write rate of the disk volume per the disk offering

arg.name: diskioread
arg.description: the read (IO) of disk on the vm

arg.name: diskiowrite
arg.description: the write (IO) of disk on the vm

arg.name: diskkbsread
arg.description: the VM's disk read in KiB

arg.name: diskkbswrite
arg.description: the VM's disk write in KiB

arg.name: diskofferingdisplaytext
arg.description: the display text of the disk offering

arg.name: diskofferingid
arg.description: ID of the disk offering

arg.name: diskofferingname
arg.description: name of the disk offering

arg.name: displayvolume
arg.description: an optional field whether to the display the volume to the end user or not.

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain associated with the disk volume

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain associated with the disk volume

arg.name: externaluuid
arg.description: volume uuid that is given by virtualisation provider (only for VMware)

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: Hypervisor the volume belongs to

arg.name: isextractable
arg.description: true if the volume is extractable, false otherwise

arg.name: isodisplaytext
arg.description: an alternate display text of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

arg.name: isoid

command.name: assignVirtualMachine
command.description: Change ownership of a VM from one account to another. This API is available for Basic zones with security groups and Advanced zones with guest networks. A root administrator can reassign a VM from any account to any other account in any domain. A domain administrator can reassign a VM to any account in the same domain.

arg.name: virtualmachineid
arg.description: id of the VM to be moved

arg.name: account
arg.description: account name of the new VM owner.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: domain id of the new VM owner.

arg.name: networkids
arg.description: list of new network ids in which the moved VM will participate. In case no network ids are provided the VM will be part of the default network for that zone. In case there is no network yet created for the new account the default network will be created.

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: an optional project for the new VM owner.

arg.name: securitygroupids
arg.description: list of security group ids to be applied on the virtual machine. In case no security groups are provided the VM is part of the default security group.

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the virtual machine

arg.name: autoscalevmgroupid
arg.description: ID of AutoScale VM group

arg.name: autoscalevmgroupname

arg.description: the total secondary storage space (in GiB) owned by account

arg.name: snapshotlimit

command.name: updateVirtualMachine
command.description: Updates properties of a virtual machine. The VM has to be stopped and restarted for the new properties to take effect. UpdateVirtualMachine does not first check whether the VM is stopped. Therefore, stop the VM manually before issuing this call.

arg.name: id
arg.description: The ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: cleanupdetails
arg.description: optional boolean field, which indicates if details should be cleaned up or not (if set to true, details removed for this resource, details field ignored; if false or not set, no action)

arg.name: customid
arg.description: an optional field, in case you want to set a custom id to the resource. Allowed to Root Admins only

arg.name: details
arg.description: Details in key/value pairs. 'extraconfig' is not allowed to be passed in details.

arg.name: dhcpoptionsnetworklist
arg.description: DHCP options which are passed to the VM on start up Example: dhcpoptionsnetworklist[0].dhcp:114=url&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].networkid=networkid&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].dhcp:66=www.test.com

arg.name: displayname
arg.description: user generated name

arg.name: displayvm
arg.description: an optional field, whether to the display the vm to the end user or not.

arg.name: extraconfig
arg.description: an optional URL encoded string that can be passed to the virtual machine upon successful deployment

arg.name: group
arg.description: group of the virtual machine

arg.name: haenable
arg.description: true if high-availability is enabled for the virtual machine, false otherwise

arg.name: instancename
arg.description: instance name of the user vm

arg.name: isdynamicallyscalable
arg.description: true if VM contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory. This can be updated only when dynamic scaling is enabled on template, service offering and the corresponding global setting

arg.name: name
arg.description: new host name of the vm. The VM has to be stopped/started for this update to take affect

arg.name: ostypeid
arg.description: the ID of the OS type that best represents this VM.

arg.name: securitygroupids
arg.description: list of security group ids to be applied on the virtual machine.

arg.name: securitygroupnames
arg.description: comma separated list of security groups names that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupids parameter

arg.name: userdata
arg.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 4KB of data after base64 encoding. Using HTTP POST(via POST body), you can send up to 1MB of data after base64 encoding.You also need to change vm.userdata.max.length value

arg.name: userdatadetails
arg.description: used to specify the parameters values for the variables in userdata.

arg.name: userdataid
arg.description: the ID of the userdata

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the virtual machine

arg.name: autoscalevmgroupid
arg.description: ID of AutoScale VM group

arg.name: autoscalevmgroupname
arg.description: Name of AutoScale VM group

arg.name: backupofferingid
arg.description: the ID of the backup offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: backupofferingname
arg.description: the name of the backup offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: bootmode
arg.description: Guest vm Boot Mode

arg.name: boottype
arg.description: Guest vm Boot Type

arg.name: cpunumber
arg.description: the number of vCPUs this virtual machine is using

arg.name: cpuspeed
arg.description: the speed of each vCPU

arg.name: cpuused
arg.description: the amount of the vm's CPU currently used

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date when this virtual machine was created

arg.name: details
arg.description: Vm details in key/value pairs.

arg.name: diskioread
arg.description: the read (IO) of disk on the VM

arg.name: diskiowrite
arg.description: the write (IO) of disk on the VM

arg.name: diskkbsread
arg.description: the VM's disk read in KiB

arg.name: diskkbswrite
arg.description: the VM's disk write in KiB

arg.name: diskofferingid
arg.description: the ID of the disk offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: diskofferingname
arg.description: the name of the disk offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: displayname
arg.description: user generated name. The name of the virtual machine is returned if no displayname exists.

arg.name: displayvm
arg.description: an optional field whether to the display the vm to the end user or not.

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the name of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: forvirtualnetwork
arg.description: the virtual network for the service offering

arg.name: group
arg.description: the group name of the virtual machine

arg.name: groupid
arg.description: the group ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: guestosid
arg.description: Os type ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: haenable
arg.description: true if high-availability is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: hostcontrolstate
arg.description: the control state of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the ID of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: the name of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which the template runs

arg.name: icon
arg.description: Base64 string representation of the resource icon

arg.name: instancename
arg.description: instance name of the user vm; this parameter is returned to the ROOT admin only

arg.name: isdynamicallyscalable
arg.description: true if vm contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory.

arg.name: memorykbs
arg.description: the memory used by the VM in KiB

arg.name: memorytargetkbs
arg.description: the target memory in VM (KiB)

arg.description: the name of the virtual machine

arg.name: networkkbsread

arg.name: networkkbswrite
arg.description: the outgoing network traffic on the host in KiB

arg.name: osdisplayname
arg.description: OS name of the vm

arg.name: ostypeid
arg.description: OS type id of the vm

arg.name: password
arg.description: the password (if exists) of the virtual machine

arg.name: passwordenabled
arg.description: true if the password rest feature is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: pooltype
arg.description: the pool type of the virtual machine

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the vm

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id of the vm

arg.name: publicip

arg.description: public IP address id associated with vm via Static nat rule

arg.name: readonlydetails
arg.description: List of read-only Vm details as comma separated string.

arg.name: receivedbytes
arg.description: the total number of network traffic bytes received

arg.description: device ID of the root volume

arg.name: rootdevicetype
arg.description: device type of the root volume

arg.name: sentbytes
arg.description: the total number of network traffic bytes sent

arg.description: the name of the service offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: servicestate
arg.description: State of the Service from LB rule

arg.name: state
arg.description: the state of the virtual machine

arg.name: templatedisplaytext
arg.description: an alternate display text of the template for the virtual machine

arg.name: templateid
arg.description: the ID of the template for the virtual machine. A -1 is returned if the virtual machine was created from an ISO file.

arg.name: templatename
arg.description: the name of the template for the virtual machine

arg.name: userdata
arg.description: Base64 string containing the user data

arg.name: userdatadetails
arg.description: list of variables and values for the variables declared in userdata

arg.name: userdataid
arg.description: the id of userdata used for the VM

arg.name: userdataname
arg.description: the name of userdata used for the VM

arg.description: the userdata override policy with the userdata provided while deploying VM

arg.description: the user's ID who deployed the virtual machine

arg.name: username
arg.description: the user's name who deployed the virtual machine

arg.name: vgpu

command.name: createIpv6FirewallRule
command.description: Creates an Ipv6 firewall rule in the given network (the network has to belong to VPC)

arg.name: networkid
arg.description: The network of the VM the Ipv6 firewall rule will be created for

arg.name: protocol
arg.description: the protocol for the Ipv6 firewall rule. Valid values are TCP/UDP/ICMP/ALL or valid protocol number

arg.name: cidrlist
arg.description: the source CIDR list to allow traffic from. Multiple entries must be separated by a single comma character (,).

arg.name: destcidrlist
arg.description: the destination CIDR list to allow traffic to. Multiple entries must be separated by a single comma character (,).

arg.name: endport
arg.description: the ending port of Ipv6 firewall rule

arg.name: fordisplay
arg.description: an optional field, whether to the display the rule to the end user or not

arg.name: icmpcode
arg.description: error code for this ICMP message

arg.name: icmptype
arg.description: type of the ICMP message being sent

arg.name: startport
arg.description: the starting port of Ipv6 firewall rule

arg.name: traffictype
arg.description: the traffic type for the Ipv6 firewall rule, can be ingress or egress, defaulted to ingress if not specified

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the port forwarding rule

arg.name: cidrlist
arg.description: the cidr list to forward traffic from. Multiple entries are separated by a single comma character (,).

arg.name: fordisplay
arg.description: is firewall for display to the regular user

arg.name: ipaddress
arg.description: the public ip address for the port forwarding rule

arg.name: ipaddressid
arg.description: the public ip address id for the port forwarding rule

arg.name: networkid
arg.description: the id of the guest network the port forwarding rule belongs to

arg.name: privateendport
arg.description: the ending port of port forwarding rule's private port range

arg.name: privateport
arg.description: the starting port of port forwarding rule's private port range

arg.name: protocol
arg.description: the protocol of the port forwarding rule

arg.name: publicendport
arg.description: the ending port of port forwarding rule's private port range

arg.name: publicport
arg.description: the starting port of port forwarding rule's public port range

arg.name: state
arg.description: the state of the rule

arg.name: virtualmachinedisplayname
arg.description: the VM display name for the port forwarding rule

arg.name: virtualmachineid
arg.description: the VM ID for the port forwarding rule

arg.name: virtualmachinename
arg.description: the VM name for the port forwarding rule

arg.name: vmguestip
arg.description: the vm ip address for the port forwarding rule

arg.name: tags(*)
arg.description: the list of resource tags associated with the rule

arg.description: the account associated with the tag

arg.description: customer associated with the tag

arg.description: id of the resource

arg.description: resource type

arg.description: Disables specified account.

arg.description: Disables specified account in this domain.

arg.description: Account id

arg.description: the id of the account

arg.description: details for the account

arg.description: account type (admin, domain-admin, user)

arg.description: the total number of cpu cores available to be created for this account

command.name: resetUserDataForVirtualMachine

arg.description: The ID of the virtual machine

arg.description: an optional project for the virtual machine

arg.name: userdata
arg.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 4KB of data after base64 encoding. Using HTTP POST(via POST body), you can send up to 1MB of data after base64 encoding.You also need to change vm.userdata.max.length value

command.name: deleteTemplate
command.description: Deletes a template from the system. All virtual machines using the deleted template will not be affected.

arg.description: the ID of the template

arg.name: forced
arg.description: Force delete a template.

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the ID of zone of the template

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success
arg.description: true if operation is executed successfully

arg.name: account
arg.description: list resources by account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: list only resources belonging to the domain specified

arg.name: fordisplay
arg.description: list resources by display flag; only ROOT admin is eligible to pass this parameter

arg.name: id
arg.description: Lists network ACL with the specified ID.

arg.name: isrecursive
arg.description: defaults to false, but if true, lists all resources from the parent specified by the domainId till leaves.

arg.name: keyword
arg.description: List by keyword

arg.name: listall
arg.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false. Resources dedicated to a project are listed only if using the projectid parameter.

arg.name: name
arg.description: list network ACLs by specified name

arg.name: networkid
arg.description: list network ACLs by network ID

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: list objects by project; if projectid=-1 lists All VMs

arg.description: list network ACLs by VPC ID

arg.description: is ACL for display to the regular user

arg.name: name
arg.description: the Name of the ACL

arg.name: vpcid
arg.description: Id of the VPC this ACL is associated with

arg.name: vpcname
arg.description: Name of the VPC this ACL is associated with

command.name: createTemplate
command.description: Creates a template of a virtual machine. The virtual machine must be in a STOPPED state. A template created from this command is automatically designated as a private template visible to the account that created it.

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: the display text of the template. This is usually used for display purposes.

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the template

arg.name: ostypeid
arg.description: the ID of the OS Type that best represents the OS of this template.

arg.name: bits
arg.description: 32 or 64 bit

arg.name: details
arg.description: Template details in key/value pairs using format details[i].keyname=keyvalue. Example: details[0].hypervisortoolsversion=xenserver61

arg.name: isdynamicallyscalable
arg.description: true if template contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory

arg.name: isfeatured
arg.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

arg.name: ispublic
arg.description: true if this template is a public template, false otherwise

arg.name: passwordenabled
arg.description: true if the template supports the password reset feature; default is false

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: create template for the project

arg.name: requireshvm
arg.description: true if the template requires HVM, false otherwise

arg.name: snapshotid
arg.description: the ID of the snapshot the template is being created from. Either this parameter, or volumeId has to be passed in

arg.name: sshkeyenabled
arg.description: true if the template supports the sshkey upload feature; default is false

arg.name: templatetag
arg.description: the tag for this template.

arg.name: url
arg.description: Optional, only for baremetal hypervisor. The directory name where template stored on CIFS server

arg.name: virtualmachineid
arg.description: Optional, VM ID. If this presents, it is going to create a baremetal template for VM this ID refers to. This is only for VM whose hypervisor type is BareMetal

arg.name: volumeid
arg.description: the ID of the disk volume the template is being created from. Either this parameter, or snapshotId has to be passed in

arg.name: id
arg.description: the template ID

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account name to which the template belongs

arg.name: accountid
arg.description: the account id to which the template belongs

arg.name: bits
arg.description: the processor bit size

arg.name: bootable
arg.description: true if the ISO is bootable, false otherwise

arg.name: checksum
arg.description: checksum of the template

arg.name: childtemplates
arg.description: if root disk template, then ids of the datas disk templates this template owns

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date this template was created

arg.name: crossZones
arg.description: true if the template is managed across all Zones, false otherwise

arg.name: deployasis
arg.description: VMware only: true if template is deployed without orchestrating disks and networks but "as-is" defined in the template.

arg.name: details

arg.name: directdownload
arg.description: KVM Only: true if template is directly downloaded to Primary Storage bypassing Secondary Storage

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which the template runs

arg.name: icon
arg.description: Base64 string representation of the resource icon

arg.name: isdynamicallyscalable
arg.description: true if template contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory

arg.description: true if the template is extractable, false otherwise

arg.name: isfeatured
arg.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

command.name: uploadCustomCertificate
command.description: Uploads a custom certificate for the console proxy VMs to use for SSL. Can be used to upload a single certificate signed by a known CA. Can also be used, through multiple calls, to upload a chain of certificates from CA to the custom certificate itself.

arg.name: certificate
arg.description: The certificate to be uploaded.

arg.name: domainsuffix
arg.description: DNS domain suffix that the certificate is granted for.

arg.name: id
arg.description: An integer providing the location in a chain that the certificate will hold. Usually, this can be left empty. When creating a chain, the top level certificate should have an ID of 1, with each step in the chain incrementing by one. Example, CA with id = 1, Intermediate CA with id = 2, Site certificate with ID = 3

arg.name: name
arg.description: A name / alias for the certificate.

arg.name: privatekey
arg.description: The private key for the attached certificate.

arg.name: message

command.name: updateTemplatePermissions
command.description: Updates a template visibility permissions. A public template is visible to all accounts within the same domain. A private template is visible only to the owner of the template. A privileged template is a private template with account permissions added. Only accounts specified under the template permissions are visible to them.

arg.description: true for featured template/iso, false otherwise

arg.description: true for public template/iso, false for private templates/isos

arg.name: op
arg.description: permission operator (add, remove, reset)

arg.description: a comma delimited list of projects. If specified, "op" parameter has to be passed in.

arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success
arg.description: true if operation is executed successfully

arg.description: zone Id

arg.description: List by keyword

command.name: createNetworkACL
command.description: Creates a ACL rule in the given network (the network has to belong to VPC)

arg.name: protocol
arg.description: the protocol for the ACL rule. Valid values are TCP/UDP/ICMP/ALL or valid protocol number

arg.name: aclid
arg.description: The network of the VM the ACL will be created for

arg.name: action
arg.description: scl entry action, allow or deny

arg.name: cidrlist
arg.description: the CIDR list to allow traffic from/to. Multiple entries must be separated by a single comma character (,).

arg.name: endport
arg.description: the ending port of ACL

arg.name: fordisplay
arg.description: an optional field, whether to the display the rule to the end user or not

arg.name: icmpcode
arg.description: error code for this ICMP message

arg.name: icmptype
arg.description: type of the ICMP message being sent

arg.name: networkid
arg.description: The network of the VM the ACL will be created for

arg.name: number
arg.description: The number of the ACL item, its ordering

arg.name: reason
arg.description: A description indicating why the ACL rule is required.

arg.name: startport
arg.description: the starting port of ACL

arg.name: traffictype
arg.description: the traffic type for the ACL,can be ingress or egress, defaulted to ingress if not specified

arg.description: the ID of the ACL Item

arg.name: aclid
arg.description: the ID of the ACL this item belongs to

arg.name: action
arg.description: Action of ACL Item. Allow/Deny

arg.name: cidrlist
arg.description: the cidr list to forward traffic from. Multiple entries are separated by a single comma character (,).

arg.name: endport
arg.description: the ending port of ACL's port range

arg.name: fordisplay
arg.description: is rule for display to the regular user

arg.name: icmpcode
arg.description: error code for this icmp message

arg.name: icmptype
arg.description: type of the icmp message being sent

arg.name: number
arg.description: Number of the ACL Item

arg.name: protocol
arg.description: the protocol of the ACL

arg.name: reason
arg.description: an explanation on why this ACL rule is being applied

arg.name: startport
arg.description: the starting port of ACL's port range

command.name: listVpnCustomerGateways

arg.name: account
arg.description: list resources by account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: list only resources belonging to the domain specified

arg.name: id
arg.description: id of the customer gateway

arg.name: isrecursive
arg.description: defaults to false, but if true, lists all resources from the parent specified by the domainId till leaves.

arg.name: keyword
arg.description: List by keyword

arg.name: listall
arg.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false. Resources dedicated to a project are listed only if using the projectid parameter.

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: list objects by project; if projectid=-1 lists All VMs

arg.name: id
arg.description: the vpn gateway ID

arg.name: account
arg.description: the owner

arg.name: cidrlist
arg.description: guest cidr list of the customer gateway. Multiple entries are separated by a single comma character (,).

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain name of the owner

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain id of the owner

arg.name: dpd
arg.description: if DPD is enabled for customer gateway

arg.name: esplifetime
arg.description: Lifetime of ESP SA of customer gateway

arg.name: esppolicy
arg.description: IPsec policy of customer gateway

arg.name: forceencap
arg.description: if Force NAT Encapsulation is enabled for customer gateway

arg.name: gateway
arg.description: public ip address id of the customer gateway

arg.name: ikelifetime
arg.description: Lifetime of IKE SA of customer gateway

arg.name: ikepolicy
arg.description: IKE policy of customer gateway

arg.name: ikeversion
arg.description: Which IKE Version to use, one of ike (autoselect), ikev1, or ikev2. Defaults to ike

arg.name: ipaddress
arg.description: guest ip of the customer gateway

arg.name: ipsecpsk
arg.description: IPsec preshared-key of customer gateway

arg.name: name
arg.description: name of the customer gateway

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id

arg.name: removed
arg.description: the date and time the host was removed

arg.name: splitconnections
arg.description: For IKEv2, whether to split multiple right subnet cidrs into multiple connection statements.

command.name: deleteManagementNetworkIpRange
command.description: Deletes a management network IP range. This action is only allowed when no IPs in this range are allocated.

arg.name: endip
arg.description: The ending IP address.

arg.name: podid
arg.description: UUID of POD, where the IP range belongs to.

arg.name: startip
arg.description: The starting IP address.

arg.name: vlan
arg.description: The vlan id the ip range sits on

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success
arg.description: true if operation is executed successfully

arg.name: mincpunumber
arg.description: the minimum number of CPUs to be set with the Kubernetes version

arg.name: minmemory
arg.description: the minimum RAM size in MB to be set with the Kubernetes version

arg.name: semanticversion
arg.description: the semantic version of the Kubernetes version. It needs to be specified in MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH format

arg.name: checksum
arg.description: the checksum value of the binaries ISO. The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed and just a plain ascii/utf8 representation of a hexadecimal string. If it is required to use another algorithm the hexadecimal string is to be prefixed with a string of the form, "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string representing the java supported algorithm, i.e. MD5 or SHA-256. Note that java does not contain an algorithm called SHA256 or one called sha-256, only SHA-256.

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the Kubernetes supported version

arg.name: url
arg.description: the URL of the binaries ISO for Kubernetes supported version

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the ID of the zone in which Kubernetes supported version will be available

arg.name: id
arg.description: the id of the Kubernetes supported version

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date when this Kubernetes supported version was created

arg.name: isoid
arg.description: the id of the binaries ISO for Kubernetes supported version

arg.name: isoname
arg.description: the name of the binaries ISO for Kubernetes supported version

arg.name: isostate
arg.description: the state of the binaries ISO for Kubernetes supported version

arg.name: mincpunumber
arg.description: the minimum number of CPUs needed for the Kubernetes supported version

arg.name: minmemory
arg.description: the minimum RAM size in MB needed for the Kubernetes supported version

arg.name: name
arg.description: Name of the Kubernetes supported version

arg.name: semanticversion
arg.description: Kubernetes semantic version

arg.name: state
arg.description: the enabled or disabled state of the Kubernetes supported version

arg.name: supportsautoscaling
arg.description: whether Kubernetes supported version supports Autoscaling

arg.name: supportsha
arg.description: whether Kubernetes supported version supports HA, multi-control nodes

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the id of the zone in which Kubernetes supported version is available

arg.name: zonename
arg.description: the name of the zone in which Kubernetes supported version is available

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the Kubernetes cluster

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success
arg.description: true if operation is executed successfully
